content:
ContractDescription Class

In this Article

Describes a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) contract that specifies what an endpoint communicates to the outside world.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("Name={name}, Namespace={ns}, ContractType={contractType}")]
public class ContractDescription

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ContractDescription

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A WCF contract is a collection of operations that specifies what the endpoint communicates to the outside world. Each operation is a message exchange. For example, a request message and an associated reply message form a request/reply message exchange.

A ContractDescription object is used to describe WCF contracts and their operations. Within a ContractDescription, each contract operation has a corresponding OperationDescription that describes aspects of the each operation that is part of the contract, such as whether the operation is one-way or request/reply. Each OperationDescription also describes the messages that make up the operation using a MessageDescriptionCollection. ContractDescription contains a reference to an interface that defines the contract using the programming model. This interface is marked with ServiceContractAttribute and its methods that correspond to endpoint operations are marked with the OperationContractAttribute.

A duplex contract defines the following logical sets of operations:

  • A set that the service exposes for the client to call.

  • A set that the client exposes for the service to call.

    The programming model for defining a duplex contract is to split each set in a separate interface and apply attributes to each interface. In this case, ContractDescription contains a reference to each of the interfaces that groups them into one duplex contract.

    Similar to bindings, each contract has a Name and Namespace that uniquely identify it in the metadata of the service.

Constructors summary

ContractDescription(String)

Initializes a new instance of the ContractDescription class with a specified name.
ContractDescription(String,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ContractDescription class with a namespace-qualified name specified.

Properties summary

Behaviors

Gets the behaviors associated with the contract description.
CallbackContractType

Gets or sets the type of callback contract that the contract description specifies.
ConfigurationName

Gets or sets the configuration name for the contract description.
ContractBehaviors

Gets the collection of behavior for the contract.
ContractType

Gets or sets the contract type that the contract description specifies.
HasProtectionLevel

Gets a value that indicates whether the contract has had a protection level set.
Name

Gets or sets the name of the contract.
Namespace

Gets or sets the namespace for the contract.
Operations

Gets the collection of operation descriptions associated with the contract.
ProtectionLevel

Gets or sets the level of security protection associated with the contract.
SessionMode

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a session is required by the contract.

Methods summary

GetContract(Type)

Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract.
GetContract(Type,Object)

Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract and service implementation.
GetContract(Type,Type)

Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract and a specified type of service.
GetInheritedContracts()

Returns a collection of contract descriptions that are inherited by the current contract description.
ShouldSerializeProtectionLevel()

Returns a value that indicates whether the stem.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel* property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.

Constructors

  • ContractDescription(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ContractDescription class with a specified name.

    public ContractDescription (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the contract.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      name is empty.

    Example

    			Dim cd0 As New ContractDescription("ICalculator")

                ContractDescription cd0 = new ContractDescription("ICalculator");
  • ContractDescription(String,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ContractDescription class with a namespace-qualified name specified.

    public ContractDescription (string name, string ns);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the contract.

    • ns
      String

      The namespace that contains the name of the contract.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      name is empty.

    Remarks

    The namespace can be an empty string ("").

    Example

    			Dim cd1 As New ContractDescription("ICalculator", "http://www.tempuri.org")

                ContractDescription cd1 = new ContractDescription("ICalculator", "http://www.tempuri.org");

Properties

  • Behaviors

    Gets the behaviors associated with the contract description.

    public System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection<System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior> Behaviors { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyedByTypeCollection<IContractBehavior>

      The stem.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1 of type IContractBehavior associated with the contract description.

    Example

    			Dim behaviors As KeyedByTypeCollection(Of IContractBehavior) = cd.Behaviors
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Display all behaviors:")
			For Each behavior As IContractBehavior In behaviors
				Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab + Constants.vbTab + CType(behavior, Object).ToString())
			Next behavior

                KeyedByTypeCollection<IContractBehavior> behaviors = cd.Behaviors;
            Console.WriteLine("    Display all behaviors:");
            foreach (IContractBehavior behavior in behaviors)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("        " + behavior.ToString());
            }
  • CallbackContractType

    Gets or sets the type of callback contract that the contract description specifies.

    public Type CallbackContractType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The Type of callback contract that the contract description specifies.

    Remarks

    The CallbackContractType property is not serializable, so it is only available when the description is bound to runtime. It cannot be imported or exported as part of the metadata.

    Example

    			Dim type As Type = cd.CallbackContractType

                Type type = cd.CallbackContractType;
  • ConfigurationName

    Gets or sets the configuration name for the contract description.

    public string ConfigurationName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The configuration name for the contract.

    Example

    			Dim cd1 As New ContractDescription("ICalculator", "http://www.tempuri.org")

                ContractDescription cd1 = new ContractDescription("ICalculator", "http://www.tempuri.org");
  • ContractBehaviors

    Gets the collection of behavior for the contract.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.KeyedCollection<Type,System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior> ContractBehaviors { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyedCollection<Type,IContractBehavior>

      The collection of behavior for the contract.

  • ContractType

    Gets or sets the contract type that the contract description specifies.

    public Type ContractType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The Type of contract that the contract description specifies.

    Remarks

    The ContractType property is not serializable, so it is only available when the description is bound to runtime. It cannot be imported or exported as part of the metadata.

    Example

    			Dim contractType As Type = cd.ContractType
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Contract type: {0}", contractType.ToString())

                Type contractType = cd.ContractType;
            Console.WriteLine("    Contract type: {0}", contractType.ToString());
  • HasProtectionLevel

    Gets a value that indicates whether the contract has had a protection level set.

    public bool HasProtectionLevel { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the protection level has been set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    When the ProtectionLevel is set, the HasProtectionLevel property is set to true.

    Example

    			Dim hasProtectionLevel As Boolean = cd.HasProtectionLevel
			If hasProtectionLevel Then
				Dim protectionLevel As ProtectionLevel = cd.ProtectionLevel
				Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Protection Level: {0}", protectionLevel.ToString())
			End If

                bool hasProtectionLevel = cd.HasProtectionLevel;
            if (hasProtectionLevel)
            {
                ProtectionLevel protectionLevel = cd.ProtectionLevel;
                Console.WriteLine("    Protection Level: {0}", protectionLevel.ToString());
            }
  • Name

    Gets or sets the name of the contract.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the contract description.

    Example

    			Dim name As String = cd.Name
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Name: {0}", name)

                string name = cd.Name;
            Console.WriteLine("    Name: {0}", name);
  • Namespace

    Gets or sets the namespace for the contract.

    public string Namespace { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The namespace of the contract.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The value set is null.

    Remarks

    The namespace can be an empty string ("").

    Example

    			Dim namespc As String = cd.Namespace
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Namespace: {0}", namespc)

                string namespc = cd.Namespace;
            Console.WriteLine("    Namespace: {0}", namespc);
  • Operations

    Gets the collection of operation descriptions associated with the contract.

    public System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescriptionCollection Operations { get; }

    Property Value

    • OperationDescriptionCollection

      The OperationDescriptionCollection that contains the operation descriptions associated with the contract description.

    Example

    			Dim odc As OperationDescriptionCollection = cd.Operations
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Display Operations:")
			For Each od As OperationDescription In odc
				Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab + Constants.vbTab + od.Name)
			Next od

                OperationDescriptionCollection odc = cd.Operations;
            Console.WriteLine("    Display Operations:");
            foreach (OperationDescription od in odc)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("        " + od.Name);
            }
  • ProtectionLevel

    Gets or sets the level of security protection associated with the contract.

    public System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel ProtectionLevel { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ProtectionLevel

      The ProtectionLevel for the operation.

    Remarks

    When the ProtectionLevel is set, the HasProtectionLevel property is set to true.

    Example

    				Dim protectionLevel As ProtectionLevel = cd.ProtectionLevel
				Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Protection Level: {0}", protectionLevel.ToString())

                    ProtectionLevel protectionLevel = cd.ProtectionLevel;
                Console.WriteLine("    Protection Level: {0}", protectionLevel.ToString());
  • SessionMode

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a session is required by the contract.

    public System.ServiceModel.SessionMode SessionMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SessionMode

      The SessionMode that specifies the support for reliable sessions that a contract requires or supports.

    Remarks

    A reliable session is a way of correlating a set of messages exchanged between two or more endpoints (using the WS-ReliableMessaging specification) to provide assurances of the reliability of the connection.

    Example

    			Dim sm As SessionMode = cd.SessionMode
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "SessionMode: {0}", sm.ToString())

                SessionMode sm = cd.SessionMode;
            Console.WriteLine("    SessionMode: {0}", sm.ToString());

Methods

  • GetContract(Type)

    Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription GetContract (Type contractType);

    Parameters

    • contractType
      Type

      The Type of contract.

    Returns

    • ContractDescription

      The ContractDescription for the specified type of contract.

    Remarks

    The difference between the GetContract overloads is that the ones with two arguments allow you to find attributes from the service (for example, OperationBehaviorAttribute).

    Example

    			Dim cd2 As ContractDescription = ContractDescription.GetContract(GetType(ICalculator))

                ContractDescription cd2 = ContractDescription.GetContract(typeof(ICalculator));
  • GetContract(Type,Object)

    Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract and service implementation.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription GetContract (Type contractType, object serviceImplementation);

    Parameters

    • contractType
      Type

      The Type of contract.

    • serviceImplementation
      System.Object

      The Object that implements the service.

    Returns

    • ContractDescription

      The ContractDescription for the specified type of contract and service implementation.

    Remarks

    The difference between the GetContract overloads is that the ones with two arguments allow you to find attributes from the service (for example, OperationBehaviorAttribute).

    Example

    			Dim calcSvc As New CalculatorService()
			Dim cd3 As ContractDescription = ContractDescription.GetContract(GetType(ICalculator), calcSvc)

                CalculatorService calcSvc = new CalculatorService();
            ContractDescription cd3 = ContractDescription.GetContract(typeof(ICalculator), calcSvc);
  • GetContract(Type,Type)

    Returns the contract description for a specified type of contract and a specified type of service.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription GetContract (Type contractType, Type serviceType);

    Parameters

    • contractType
      Type

      The Type of contract.

    • serviceType
      Type

      The Type of service.

    Returns

    • ContractDescription

      The ContractDescription for the specified type of contract and type of service.

    Remarks

    The difference between the GetContract overloads is that the ones with two arguments allow you to find attributes from the service (for example, OperationBehaviorAttribute).

    Example

    			Dim cd4 As ContractDescription = ContractDescription.GetContract(GetType(ICalculator), GetType(CalculatorService))

                ContractDescription cd4 = ContractDescription.GetContract(typeof(ICalculator), typeof(CalculatorService));
  • GetInheritedContracts()

    Returns a collection of contract descriptions that are inherited by the current contract description.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> GetInheritedContracts ();

    Returns

    • Collection<ContractDescription>

      The stem.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1 of type ContractDescription that is inherited by the current contract description.

    Example

    			Dim inheretedContracts As Collection(Of ContractDescription) = cd.GetInheritedContracts()
			Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab & "Inherited Contracts:")
			For Each contractdescription As ContractDescription In inheretedContracts
				Console.WriteLine(Constants.vbTab + Constants.vbTab + contractdescription.Name)
			Next contractdescription

                Collection<ContractDescription> inheretedContracts = cd.GetInheritedContracts();
            Console.WriteLine("    Inherited Contracts:");
            foreach (ContractDescription contractdescription in inheretedContracts)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("        " + contractdescription.Name);
            }
  • ShouldSerializeProtectionLevel()

    Returns a value that indicates whether the stem.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel* property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.

    public bool ShouldSerializeProtectionLevel ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.ProtectionLevel* property value should be serialized; otherwise, false.
